title: Urban Classroom Culture & Interaction 2: From Research to Professional Practice
abstractText:
Our 2005-8 research (UCCI) showed that in many classrooms, commitment to learning is no longer routinely associated with deference to the teacher, authority is often decentred, and popular and new media culture permeate everyday talk.

This project has 3 main elements:

  1. A flexible professional development programme to be developed and trialled with teachers. in a variety of sites and formats. Research findings will be used to address a range of issues (eg roles, identities, digital technology and popular culture in urban classrooms), and to enable participants to investigate their own classrooms. There will be three c. 3-session courses run by local authorities; one c.6 session course in a school-wide change programme; c.3 sessions in an MA module; and 2-3 sessions in a PGCE programme.
  2. A set of resources for wider distribution which will be consolidated from the professional development programme. It is envisaged that these materials will be presented in a book of c. 120 pages and a CD of classroom talk - which will be disseminated through local authorities and/or professional associations. 
  3. A post-project seminar with policy-makers, professionals and researchers to promote an informed understanding of the nature and purposes of the resource materials.
